articles.description: Ireland's heavy defeat by France to open the Six Nations will only further press questions raised by a lacklustre autumn.
articles.title: Six Nations: Farrell's Ireland must 'stop rot' after Paris humbling

articles.description: World Anti-Doping chiefs will investigate claims male ski jumpers are injecting their penises in a bid to improve sporting performance, if a complaint is made.
articles.title: Ski jumping: Wada responds to penis injection claims

articles.description: Leicester City are docked six points by the English Football League for breaching financial rules.
articles.title: Leicester City docked six points by EFL for financial breaches

articles.description: Chelsea boss Liam Rosenior says Arsenal were affecting his side's warm-up prior to the second leg of their Carabao Cup semi-final at Emirates Stadium.
articles.title: Arsenal lack of respect in warm-up behind outburst - Chelsea boss Liam Rosenior

articles.description: Jack Draper claims an emphatic victory on his long-awaited return from injury to give Great Britain a 1-0 lead over Norway in Davis Cup qualifying.
articles.title: Davis Cup: Jack Draper beats Viktor Durasovic to give Great Britain lead over Norway in qualifying

articles.description: Former Great Britain sprinter Reece Prescod gives the clearest indication yet that he will take performance-enhancing drugs as part of the controversial Enhanced Games.
articles.title: Enhanced Games: British sprinter Reece Prescod 'not against' taking drugs for competition

articles.description: Immanuel Feyi-Waboso is an injury doubt for England's Six Nations opener against Wales on Saturday after the wing pulls up in training on Thursday.
articles.title: Immanuel Feyi-Waboso: England wing a doubt for Wales Six Nations match

articles.description: British number one Emma Raducanu storms into the semi-finals of the Transylvania Open with a commanding victory over Poland's Maja Chwalinska.
articles.title: Emma Raducanu storms into Cluj semi-finals with win over Maja Chwalinska, Sonay Kartal beaten

articles.description: Michael van Gerwen seals victory on the 2026 Premier League's opening night by beating fellow Dutchman Gian van Veen in the final in Newcastle.
articles.title: Premier League Darts 2026 results: Michael van Gerwen beats Gian van Veen to win opening night in Newcastle

articles.description: Newcastle United midfielder Sandro Tonali is a target for Juventus, Portugal forward Cristiano Ronaldo has a release clause in his Al-Nassr contract, Napoli are set to hold talks to extend Scott McTominay's contract, plus more.
articles.title: Football gossip: Tonali, Lewandowski, Ronaldo, McTominay, Duran, Lingard
